page.title: 08LOLLIPOP LADIES
page.content: Lollipop ladies are School Crossing Patrollers, who help children to cross busy roads on their way to and from school. They are called Lollipop Ladies because they carry a pole shaped like a giant lollipop with the words{STOP CHILDREN}printed on it. Mrs McCourt has been a Lollipop Lady for nearly ten years. She wears special clothing which includes a white linen coat, a fluorescent-yellow waterproof PVC waistcoat, white waterproof trousers, a yellow and white PVC hat and black gloves. She was once nearly involved in an accident when she was on duty. A boy was almost knocked down when a car failed to stop at the crossing. This really upset her but apart from this incident she enjoys her work very much, but she still gets nervous with cars and lorries speeding towards her!
